intro: Phlegmariurus pearcei, commonly known as the pearce's haircap, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and small, closely spaced leaves that are often covered in a layer of fine, silky hairs. This moss typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. It is found primarily in temperate regions of the southern hemisphere, including parts of South America and Australia. The plant plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various invertebrates.
